intro: Merendera greuteri, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the genus Merendera in the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Merendera greuteri is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
